name: Jacob Fitzwater
text: Easy and quick from boarding pass printing to gate finding.

name: Rodney Delack
text: Very nice clean airport. Staff was very friendly everywhere.

name: Devri Cheatam
text: It's where I know people. They're polite and friendly.

name: David Brown
text: Ladies at check in were very nice and helpful today. Good trip so far☆☆☆☆☆

name: Rian King
text: It's allot smaller to get and out of the Airport. For me I love it allot smaller to get and out of the Airport .

name: Chris Scott
text: Clean very good staff.

name: Anon Anon
text: The car rental department is the worst. Beware of hertz.

name: michelle wright
text: Small airport, but easy to navigate through. Very friendly staff

name: Wayne Hoffman
text: Very clean and friendly

name: Stephen Simmons
text: The breakfast buffet was and the staff was great

name: Ashley Richardson
text: Great place

name: Sharon Calhoun
text: Visiting

name: Miss Lan Pretty
text: Just driving by

name: Shaun Wood
text: Avoid sending your loved ones here if at all possible. I have nothing but horror stories regarding the treatment (or lack thereof) of my father.

name: Peño Watson
text: Best service all around I’ve ever had at ANY hospital in Birmingham or surrounding area. Puts UAB in the dirt and makes St. Vincent look like an animal hospital.

name: Sandra K Bailey
text: Have a great doctor there. All staff were professional and treated me so nice. Up to date facility, profession staff, and respect for me as a patient on office visit and test I had done there. Highly recommend this hospital!!!!

name: Margie Norton
text: Oh the care I got here is so amazing. I love all the nurses that took care of me and I love the doctors. Wonderful bedside manner and you can't imagine the things they have in hospitals now. Special hand held gadgets that show the veins on your skin so they can find blood. Blows me away.

name: Judi Castro
text: The staff here is always professional, caring and kind.  We have never been disappointed in the care that we have received and would and have recommended to family and friends.  My husband and I have been to the E.R. several times over the last couple of years and were pleased that our wait time was not more than an hour.  My husband has had 2 shoulder surgeries,  been in the cath lab twice and I've had shoulder surgery.  We were very impressed with the state of the art equipment as well as the health care providers and medical staff.  The day surgery is very organized and efficient in that the staff is diligent in keeping whomever is waiting on the patient in the loop of how things are progressing.  Over the years we have been to most of the surrounding hospitals but after we had our first experience with Grandview we have never returned to any of them for our care.

name: Kate King
text: I have now had 3 experiences at Grandview and all of them were wonderful. Their labor and delivery department is amazing! (I've had 2 children there, the nurses are so kind and attentive. One asked if I was craving anything, I said chocolate as a joke but she went to the gift shop and bought me chocolate!) And we had to bring our son as a newborn in. The only thing was the resident that was seeing us in the ER did not know how to get an oxygen reading on such a small baby, but we were quickly taken up to the NICU and our experience there was wonderful. I honestly love this hospital.

name: Britney Rice J
text: I held this hospital in really high regards but I'm not sure if I feel the same way now. When I brought my children in they got really good service from the particular doctor that was there. I had to be seen yesterday due to chronic pain on my ride side that turned out to be my gallbladder. The student put in my IV BUT after drawing blood I received no intravenous fluids. After a while the doctor came in, asked me questions and then performed an ultrasound. She first said that all my organs looked fine but then noticed I had gallstones. She ordered another ultrasound and an x-ray. After waiting a while for the results she came back in and said everything looked fine and that I should see a GI doctor.. she then wrote me a prescription for Bentyl. I asked her what to do about my pain and she said to just take the medicine and that "THEY" said everything was good. However the diagnosis on the paper says Cholecystitis and says to need a completely different treatment than I was given. However I am still in pain and am praying that the situation doesn't get worse!

name: Debbie Seale
text: I went to see my husband to on 1-22-2019 room 826 I have to I am his wife of 46 years I got a chance to see him he was dirty his wrap had food all over he was not given any thing to brush his teeth wash  heteven smelled this is the worst I have ever seen a hospital to need I will be calling on him he

name: Sandra Gillott
text: Grand view is wonderful. I would suggest it to anybody.

name: Sue Lee
text:
One star is too much.i hated every day my son was in this so called hospital. Horror stories
He has passed away now so they don’t have to worry about mistreating him ever again

name: Felicia Reynolds
text: Wrong diagnosis  and further damages, also made me lose a 15year life insurance policy based on complete lies. The COO Mrs. NORTHCUTT, stated she did not know how it triggered into my file an entire narrative that I unintentionally  overdosed  on something  that wasn't in my system.  I was treated with a powerful drug to reverse an overdose of Tylenol  in which I did not even take. If anyone could  assist me with clearing my records legally  please help me. I went into Acute Liver failure and because It took me almost two years to recover mentally, physically,  and emotionally I can't get legal assistance.  The COO said she would change it but to this date! I can't get insurance and I am flagged as an abuser of Tylenol... Thank God , I was sent to UAB and received a Liver Transplant.  Grandview kept me doped up and dying for eleven days  on the surgical icu unit charged my insurance over $100,000 for eleven days. I want to know everything about my care at Grandview ! They was forcing me to take pain meds even though  I said I wasn't in pain.. I had to spit them in a cup once they left the room. It was awful!!!! Help me!!! FELICIA REYNOLDS

name: Thomas Murphy
text: Great hospital an great staff

name: Thao Nguyen
text: Bad service ever

name: Justine Amos
text: Terrible customer service . Will never go back to this hospital again

name: Rosalind Lewis
text: Luxury apartments. The signs say 'apartment homes'. We who do not want the amenities of pool, fitness center, tennis courts price included in our monthly rent are destined to lower our way of life and Hoover, Alabama is parallel to many cities.

name: Rosalind Lewis
text: The bench at the Bus stop was a welcomed seat. I was blessed by a resident with an umbrella on a day rain began. I was Thankful for the bus stop location.

name: Collier Clark
text: Not much to say. The vacant stores are filling back up so that's a plus. Easy access and you can almost always find a parking spot.

name: Corinna Bass
text: They have really remodeled this place so beautifully. There aren’t many stores left here, but Macy’s and Victoria’s Secret, Books A Million remain.  As well as Foot Locker, Hibbits,Charlotte Ruze, Z Gallery are still there.  Food Court is extremely limited, but beautiful.

name: Tom Atkins
text: I won a silent auction item donated by Brookwood Mall that included a $10 gift card from all Brookwood Mall Merchants. I waited over a year to redeem it and when I tried to redeem it I was told that the card had a zero balance. But I never used it...then I looked closely at the back of the gift card and read, “Unless prohibited by law, a $2.50 fee will be deducted monthly from Card balance starting 1st day after 1 year of inactivity.”  What brilliant marketing genius approved that?  Oh well Galleria here I come!!!

name: Opal Hall
text: A nice place, but wish they had more stores. Almost was a waste of time, compared to the Galleria, especially.

name: Gissell Juarez
text: It's needs more stores but great customer service

name: Peter Ray
text: Great seating, bathrooms, stores, restaurants and staff

name: Donald Barger
text: Love this mall

name: Bailey Pappas
text: I wish there was more stores like there used to be.

name: syretta robbins
text: Ok place but can get super busy

name: Andrew S
text: Cashier was so rude. Did not greet us not speak. Who trains them?????

name: Jeffry Schumerth
text: Low prices

name: Joe Busa
text: Check in was easy. A/C worked perfectly. The place seemed clean. I’m giving one star because of the bed. It’s the second most uncomfortable bed I’ve ever slept in. My back hurts. I think it’s made of plywood.

name: Jerome “PirateKing” Johnson II
text: Another one of chick fil a's many great locations. Didn't have much time before work to stop but I did anyway and they got me in and it in no time with fresh food and plenty free sauce which is hard to come by anywhere else. The workers were extremely friendly like they always are and my order is always right the first time with less than five minutes average time in the drive thru even on their busiest day this is why I always stop even when I'm short on time

name: Sonya Ross
text: Great food truck at the Chevron. Every thing is fresh & made to order. Philky cheese steak & fries $10.00

name: George Mwasumbi
text: Stayed here for one night while visiting Oakwood. The rooms were comfortable and clean, and the room service was very efficient. The staff were polite and willing to help in any way, and the breakfast inthe morning was also great!

name: Kevin Howell
text: First, walked in our room and it smelled like stale cigarettes in a non smoking room, all of the drink machine were out of drinks so you had to buy from there store downstairs that was way over priced. And finally while we were gone housekeeping came in to replace the towels and took money that was hidden out of site under clothing. They clearly went through our things and it made me very uneasy.

name: Terri Lane Robertson
text: Great place to stay.  Amazing staff and accommodations. Full service breakfast that is to die for! Spacious rooms.

name: chairit chinnoros
text:
(Translated by Google) Good service for both food and accommodation.

(Original)
บริการดีทั้งอาหารและที่พัก

name: Daniel KImbrough
text: Nice

name: Josh Phillips
text:
I try to visit all the Confederate memorials with my children when I travel across the South. I am a direct decedent of Confederate veterans. To see a huge box around the monument in Linn Park on veterans day was disturbing to say the least.
However it led to a beautiful discussion about Government and why we don't need them. Kinda the same conversation that was held between men that decided to leave this Union that held no respect for them.
As for the homeless living in that park they were very nice and polite. Maybe you could put a roof on the box and let them have a place to stay out of the elements.

name: Susan Johnson
text: Very impressed with the staff and organization of this hospital. My daughter had a procedure yesterday morning and we didn’t even get to sit down before we were called back. Even though construction is going on, everything was handled smoothly. The doctors, anesthesiologists, and nurses were ready for her; there was no waiting. In the Surgery Waiting area for the families is a large screen telling the family when the patient is in the Operating Room, in Recovery, and Ready to go. Free coffee is set up there on a cart for the families waiting as well as a large TV. We were so well cared for that the time flew by. This is not my first time I have had a family member at Brookwood Hospital and I find it very accommodating whether in the main hospital or their Women’s Center. The Valet Parking makes it easier to get in to see your loved ones!

name: Kyle Kapps
text: My name is David Kyle Capps. In January 2020 I stayed in the psychiatric unit at brookwood hospital. I was abused by a staff member named Calvin. The charge nurse rowanda ordered me from my original room with a roommate to a small single bed room. It was there in front of two other staff members calvin threw me across the bed onto the floor on the other side of it. I told my psychiatrist Dr. Chili this had happened and I wanted to see a patient advocate. I also told other staff members this had happened one, a therapist who's name I can't recall. The therapist did exercise therapy where we used chairs for support. Eventually I was discharged escorted by security to my ride. Never having seen the patient advocate. I was in the hospital for 2 weeks before discharging. And was found competent to discharge at a court hearing. Thats the facts as I recall them. This abuse and neglect of Dr. Chili to allow me to speak a patient advocate left me scared for my wellbeing up until my discharge. It's taken this many months and moving many states away before I felt comfortable sharing what happened. Brookwood psychiatric has a bottom floor I have heard other staff members talking to each other refer to that floor as the dungeon or pit. Protect your loved ones and don't get psychiatric care there. Secret abuses happen, threats of bodily harm also happen followed by actual physical harm. Team brookwood seems to circle the wagons to cover it. This is my truth it happened to me.

name: Quincy Murray
text: Great hospital

name: Blue Magic
text:
Everyone that I came into contact with had a great attitude in the emergency department!
When I came back a nurse went out of her way to show me to my destination! The other hospitals in the area need to take notes.📝

name: Patty Griffith
text: Before, during and after my surgery at Brookwood Hospital I was taken such good care of by there staff on Medical Center Drive. Dr. Rookis is an excellent urologist and put my worries at rest.

name: Amanda J
text:
What can I say... our loved one has had the best of care here and, at times, the most mediocre. They were not adequately staffed for the Christmas holiday season. Adequate holiday staffing is an issue that should be addressed and assessed immediately.

It's disheartening to have a loved one in need of some basic care... I'm not talking about anything above and beyond, just basic, and it takes a nurse or a nurses aide soooooo long to attend to a patient.

name: Redeana Russell
text: The Doctors and nurses and staff are awesome . They really care about you and your family..

name: Gary Grace
text: Love Dr McAlexander he is such a nice person and treats his patients and they're family wonderfully

name: Russ Conaway
text: Best Hospital in Alabama. Wouldn't go anywhere else.

name: Kamryn McClain
text: The people that work here are awesome
